alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Greenbrier County through 430 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lewisburg, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Very Heavy Rainfall. Frequent Lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Excessive rainfall could result in minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Ponding of water on roads and highways is likely. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Ronceverte... Renick... Neola... Falling Spring... and Asbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
